info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 4:56PM EDT until March 31 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Broome County in central New York... Southwestern Delaware County in central New York... South central Chenango County in central New York... Susquehanna County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northwestern Wayne County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 456 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Windsor to near Brackney to near Montrose to Springville, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Kirkwood, Conklin, Jackson, Walton, Sanford, Colchester, Susquehanna, Deposit, Susquehanna Depot and Springville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Heavy rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
